name: Waterford Marina Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights, hotel was spotless, great for families, staff were so friendly and helpful, loved the secure lock up garage for the car, ate in the bar each night, have to say the only down point was the restaurant food... comes from the same kitchen as the bar menu.. but was very disappointing.. prawn cocktail was flavourless.. soggy, main course was a steaming hot pork chop served on a bed of lukewarm partially mashed potatoes... :(
reviews.title: Loved the Place!

reviews.text: Would absolutely recommend this hotel, but would suggest the Pub Grub as opposed to the actual Restaurant Menu... BIG Thank you to the Bar Staff, Management Team, Housekeeping... made our stay an absolute delight... will be back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: Met up with a friend here for two nights and was most impressed with the hotel.. Both our rooms were spotless and with great river views. Beds comfortable, spacious washrooms and great water pressure for shower! Bar and Restaurant very cozy and likewise offer great views. Breakfast was great with more choice than one would ever need but dinner was spectacular! I had a package which included dinner and the quality and presentation of each dish was equal to the finest restaurant anywhere. One of the best meals I have ever had. Staff throughout the hotel were courteous and pleasant. A delightful stay!
reviews.title: dreadful /noisy/dirty

reviews.text: This is a motel disguised as a real hotel.Weekend with children was dismal - hotel had loud music untill 1p.m. then drunken revellers outside till 4p.m.Suitcases were then collected from foreign travellers @ 5.30.a.m.reception floors sticky and dirty.Flying gnats outside as hotel is on a dirty looking tidal river.horrible place.
reviews.title: lovely place

reviews.text: free parking
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel & very friendly staff!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a warm welcome from friendly staff on reception, the room was immaculately clean and had a lovely view over the river. We had an evening meal included in the package, there was a good choice and the food was excellent as was our lovely waitress. The breakfast was excellent with a good choice of cereals, fruit, breads etc., as well as a choice of hot dishes, we had the full Irish it was 1st class and once again we had a super waitress and nothing was too much trouble. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Excellent Value

reviews.text: The staff was welcoming on arrival. Our room was very nice with a view of the river. We were nervous when we realized that the bar patrons outside were very loud, but after we closed the window, we were not disturbed. I encountered many friendly people in this town, but there really was nothing going on. We were glad that we had arrived late, and we quickly got out of town the next morning. The hotel was a wonderful place to make a quick stop, and the town was lovely, but don't expect to find much happening.
reviews.title: Peaceful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found it easily, buzzed for the car park and reception came to open the back door for us (a nice touch - it was raining!). Reasonably priced bar meal, clean and comfortable rooms. Got it for a bargain rate. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover

reviews.text: We have just checked out from a one nights stay and you could not fault this hotel the staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was great worth spending money on with a great view of the river. Comp paper and kiddy bag a nice touch.
reviews.title: Well worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night with my wife as part of our tour of Ireland. Good room and facilities. Didn't eat in restaurant but ate in bar and food was fine. Breakfast good also. Parking safe and secure in sealed on site car park.
reviews.title: Good stay in city centre

reviews.text: We were at the Waterford Marina Hotelfor just one night, and we were enchanted . . . We were staying in a family room which was huge and comfortable. Bedding was very good, the bathroom also good, with the only drawback (which seems to be pretty common in Ireland) of two separate taps, one for cold and one for hot water. The room overlooked a beautiful portion of river, with swans and other aquatic birds swimming in it. It was really a nice experience, which we hope to repeat . . .
reviews.title: We'll certainly go back!

reviews.text: I absolutely love this hotel and stay there everytime I am in waterford it is my home from home so to speak.
reviews.title: Home from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evening meal was excellent, restaurant staff very accomodating and efficient.
reviews.title: Meh!

reviews.text: The view of the river from my room was wonderful, swans swimming about very atmospheric.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Friendly staff, Great Value

reviews.text: Excellent manager and team, friendly and welcoming, making you feel you are special.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.text: Waterford does not have much to recommend it when compared to Dublin or Kilkenny, which is nearby. There was nothing to do here in the evenings; but everyone passes through because of the crystal factory which is downsized considerably from what it once was because most of the crystal manufacturing has been out-sourced to the Czech Republic.
reviews.title: Not an exciting place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is clean but does not offer much in the way of amenities. The evening staff are young and very eager to please guests. Michelle is a real gem who ought to consider a career in the Hospitality sector. She has the personality and gift for it.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: As this was my 5th trip to Ireland, I would recommend staying in Kilkenny and/or spending a night or two in a B & B rather than staying here.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerful

reviews.text: A lovely view from our room and the hotel location is right on the water. Our room was pleasant. We were only there for one night but have no complaints. We had dinner in the hotel and the food was excellent.
reviews.title: One night was enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely friendly little hotel right in the heart of Waterford City situated right on the bank of the River View. Pleasant and speedy check in , secure underground parking and goodie bags for eager little children.
reviews.title: Good hotel close to the centre

description: The warm comfortable 3 star hotel is situated in the heart of Waterford City on a well maintained cobbled road overlooking the River Suir. You can enjoy a stroll along Scotch Quay onto The Mall where you will find The Bishops Palace, House of Waterford Crystal, Reginalds Tower and much more. The Waterford Marina Hotel is perfectly situated for all visitors to the City, Heritage, Shopping and Nightlife all on our doorstep.
